data.title: Foster Transparency of Judicial Decisions and Enhancing the National Implementation of the ECHR (TJENI)

TJENI Supports Development of the Anonymisation Tool to Foster Transparency of the Romanian Judiciary

ROMANIA

In a significant stride towards enhancing legal transparency and safeguarding personal data, the anonymisation (pseudonymisation) tool has been developed in the framework of the TJENI project. The Romanian Academy Research Institute for Artificial Intelligence “Mihai Drăgănescu” (RACAI), in close...

Lithuanian Courts Benefit from Speech Recognition Technology to Expedite Legal Proceedings

Lithuania

With the aim of streamlining legal proceedings, the TJENI project has supported the National Courts Administration (NCA) of Lithuania to integrate speech recognition software into its court infrastructure. The implementation of this tool resulted in the reduce of the workload of court staff and...

CYPRUS

Workshop on supporting Digital Transformation of Hellenic Judiciary through change management

Athens, Greece

A workshop held on 10 April 2024 in Athens co-organised by the TJENI project and the Hellenic Ministry of Justice, addressed several aspects of reform in the Greek judicial system and its management. The workshop was opened by the Secretary General of Justice and Human Rights of the MoJ Mr. Panos...

HUDOC: Launch of the Romanian version

BUCAREST, ROMANIA

On 5 April 2024, in Bucharest more than 120 legal professionals from the Romanian and Moldovan judiciary, academia and bar associations in person and online attended the launch of the Romanian-language user interface of the HUDOC case-law database (https://hudoc.echr.coe.int/rum). The user...

GREECE

ONLINE

The new online course on the protection of personal data in the publication of judicial decisions developed in the framework of the TJENI project has been launched today! The course addresses the complex balance between legal transparency, the right to privacy and personal data protection....
